intro: Campanula afra var. cleystogama, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine white pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate, long-lasting blooms that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
